title: Thirsty AI technology could strain Aussie water supply
description: Data centres supporting artificial intelligence technology could use as much as 20 per cent of the water supply in some cities unless policies change.
content:
Artificial intelligence technology could demand as much as 20 per cent of Sydney's water supply within a decade, and data centre developers are already asking for access to 40 million litres a day.

title: AI Godfather says CS degrees matter, but mid-level programmers might be replaced by AI soon
description: Geoffrey Hinton, the ‘Godfather of AI’, says that while artificial intelligence is rapidly reshaping the software industry, a computer science degree still holds significant value. However, Hinton warns that mid-level programming roles may not remain secure for much longer.
content: The rapid advancement of artificial intelligence is reshaping the tech industry at bottleneck speed. Many companies are already automating several work areas including the process of writing code. And this is raising questions whether holding a degre... [2737 chars]

title: Japan uses AI to crack down on manga, anime piracy
description: Japan is turning to artificial intelligence to combat the massive rise in manga and anime piracy, a problem that costs publishers an estimated US$55 billion a
content:
Japan is turning to artificial intelligence to combat the massive rise in manga and anime piracy, a problem that costs publishers an estimated US$55 billion a year, according to the anti-piracy group Authorised Books of Japan.

title: Powering Brunei’s AI future
description: BANDAR SERI BEGAWAN: Unified National Networks Sdn Bhd (UNN), in partnership with EVYD Technology Sdn Bhd, has successfully deployed high-performance AI GPU servers at its Colocation Hosting facility, marking a significant milestone with the launch of Brunei's first national artificial intelligence (AI) application platform to support the Ministry of Health (MoH) and its BruHealth app users.
